args.query: Mathlib4 is_topological_basis Lean4 is_topological_basis topology basis
mathlib4 topological basis IsTopologicalBasis "basis" topology mathlib4 Lean4 "topological_basis"

args.natural_language_statement: Show that the collection B = {(a,b) | a < b, a and b rational} is a basis that generates a topology different from the lower limit topology on R. Translate to Lean4: define B as the set of open intervals with rational endpoints (viewed as subsets of ℝ); define C as the usual lower limit basis of half-open intervals [a,b) with real endpoints; state lemmas that B is a topological basis and that the topology generated by B is not equal to the lower limit topology; end each statement with := by sorry. Import Mathlib at the top.

Import Mathlib at top. End statements with := by sorry.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Basis consisting of open intervals with rational endpoints, viewed as subsets of ℝ. -/
def B : Set (Set ℝ) := { s | ∃ (a b : ℚ), (a < b) ∧ s = Set.Ioo (a : ℝ) (b : ℝ) }

/-- Lower limit basis consisting of half-open intervals [a,b) with real endpoints. -/
def C : Set (Set ℝ) := { s | ∃ (a b : ℝ), (a < b) ∧ s = Set.Ico a b }

/-- The collection B is a topological basis for the topology it generates. -/
theorem B_is_basis : @TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis ℝ (TopologicalSpace.generateFrom B) B := by sorry

/-- The topology generated by B is different from the lower limit topology generated by C. -/
theorem top_of_B_ne_lower_limit : TopologicalSpace.generateFrom B ≠ TopologicalSpace.generateFrom C := by sorry
